core_quotes.speaker: Jasmine Mahmoud
core_quotes.text: When we ask ourselves, 'How am I going to do this?' or 'What if it doesn't work?' Those questions put us in a bad state. What if we replace them with: 'What would make today successful?'

core_quotes.speaker: Jasmine Mahmoud
core_quotes.text: We don't need generic productivity hacks. We actually need nervous system interventions.

core_quotes.speaker: Jasmine Mahmoud
core_quotes.text: On the horizon, potentially countering culture of despair... that's what gets me excited. It would be a lifelong journey.

reactions.speaker: Julie Dorshkind
reactions.quote: This is amazing. I've never heard a framework like that before.

reactions.speaker: Stara Shakti
reactions.quote: This could be a TED talk.

reactions.speaker: Doug Snyder
reactions.quote: Jasmine, use your framework. I want to hear, what is the one thing, your one thing that you want to do, and we'll check in.

reactions.speaker: Julie Dorshkind
reactions.quote: The language is so key. The question 'what would make today successful' versus 'what do I need to get done' - completely different energy.

ripple_effects.speaker: Lizzy Summers
ripple_effects.description: Immediately applied the framework to her own day
ripple_effects.quote: I'll figure out one thing I want to do today. Just one thing.

ripple_effects.speaker: Julie Dorshkind
ripple_effects.description: Connected to her coaching work with clients

speaker_evolution.started_with: Presenting a generic question framework for productivity
speaker_evolution.ended_with: Iterated to more specific version after Doug's challenge; committed to applying it herself
speaker_evolution.catalyst: Doug's challenge to use her own framework

attributions_given.context: Earlier input that helped refine the question
attributions_given.quote: Doug, you actually helped me refine this earlier

themes.name: Nervous System Over Productivity
themes.description: The insight that what we need isn't better productivity systems but interventions that regulate our nervous system state

themes.name: Power of Question Framing
themes.description: How the specific words we use in self-inquiry change our state and outcomes
